findings.title: Contract with payable function but lack of withdraw function
findings.description: In contract `DiamondUpgradeInit` has payable function `forceDeployL2Contract`, but it lacks of withdraw function or logic, this may lead to ETH locked in the contract.

findings.title: Potential Security Issue if revealing secret X
findings.description: Revealing the X value can compromise the trapdoor and allow an adversary to forge a valid recursive proof.

findings.title: Should check whether the transfer is successful
findings.description: The transfer function defined in the interface seems to have no return value type, which contradicts the IERC20 interface standard. The function doesn't check whether the transfer is successful.

findings.title: Useless mappings should be deleted
findings.description: The special operator delete in Solidity is used to release space. To encourage active recycling of space, releasing space will return some gas.

findings.title: Unused Input Parameter
findings.description: The function `_blockMetaParameters` doesn't use the input parameter calldata `_block`.

findings.title: IL2Bridge function l1TokenAddress and l1Bridge implementation never defined
findings.description: The `l1TokenAddress` and `l1Bridge` functions are undefined but their interfaces are defined.

findings.title: msg.value should be restricted when depositing ERC20
findings.description: When users deposit ERC20, they may attach many Ether coins due to operational errors, with no way to retrieve them, which will result in the loss of Ether coins.

findings.title: claimFailedDeposit logic may leads to double spend risk
findings.description: The L1 bridge's claimFailedDeposit function does not check the asset status on L2 before claiming failed deposits, which can lead to a potential double spend attack.
